original_text:
This is an **AGE[in 80s]- year-old Caucasian male admitted to the **INSTITUTION with chief complaint of congestive heart failure .
HISTORY :
This patient presented to the **INSTITUTION Emergency Room , extremely short of breath .
It started rather abruptly at home , and brought into the ER , appeared to be __________ failure and was subsequently admitted .
PAST MEDICAL HISTORY :
The patient had an myocardial infarction in 2005 , had PTCA and stenting .
He has a known history of hypothyroidism , hypercholesterolemia , hyperlipidemia , and remote history of non-Hodgkin lymphoma in the past .
ALLERGIES :
None .
HOSPITAL COURSE :
The patient was admitted to the 5M cardiac stepdown , and he was diuresed .
He showed good improvement with his failure .
We have repeated his echo , still has a very low ejection fraction around 30% .
There was no evidence of recurrent MI .
Troponins were all negative .
The patient had some slight increase in his BUN and creatinine .
We are going to need to watch that closely as an outpatient .
The patient 's condition has stabilized and could be discharged today to be followed as an outpatient .
LABORATORY DATA :
Chemistries on admission ; BUN was 30 and creatinine 1.7 .
Had a slight rise to 40 and 2.3 , and I will watch it very closely as an outpatient .
Electrolytes were normal .
Troponin was negative on admission .
CBC :
Hemoglobin 13.2 , hematocrit 38.4 , and white blood cell count 5600 .
BNP was elevated at 1030 on admission .
TSH was elevated at 38.26 , and cardiology did increase his thyroid supplement .
CT of the head was done by neurology services because of benign tremor and that was unremarkable .
Ventilation profusion scan showed no evidence of pulmonary emboli .
Echocardiography done during this admission showed dyskinetic wall motion and left ventricular function around 30% .
FINAL DISCHARGE DIAGNOSES :
1. Congestive heart failure .
2. Ischemic cardiomyopathy with an ejection fraction of 30% .
3. Hypothyroidism .
4. Benign essential tremor .
5. Chronic renal failure .
DISCHARGE PLANNING AND INSTRUCTIONS :
The patient will be discharged today , **DATE[Aug 5 2007] , to home in improved condition .
MEDICATIONS :
I will continue on the following medications
1. Aspirin 325 mg daily .
2. Lipitor 10 mg nightly .
3. Coreg 3.125 mg b.i.d.
4. Lasix 40 mg daily .
5. Levothyroxine 200 mcg daily .
6. K-Dur 10 mEq daily .
7. Lanoxin 0.125 mg Monday , Wednesday , and Friday .
The patient will maintain a healthy heart , low-sodium diet .
We will have a homecare nurse see the patient for congestive heart failure followup .
The patient is going to have a basic metabolic profile done on Thursday , **DATE[Aug 11 2007] .
The patient will follow up in my office on Friday , **DATE[Aug 12 2007] , at 4 p.m. for reevaluation .
______________________________
**NAME[YYY M. ZZZ] , D.O.
HS Job # 511421 / 41125 / 31782
# **ID-NUM
D :
**DATE[Aug 05 2007] 08:25
T :
**DATE[Aug 07 2007] 00:06
